metadata.title: CVE-2024-25629 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests. `ares__read_line()` isused to parse local configuration files such as `/etc/resolv.conf`,`/etc/nsswitch.conf`, the `HOSTALIASES` file, and if using a c-ares versionprior to 1.27.0, the `/etc/hosts` file. If any of these configuration fileshas an embedded `NULL` character as the first character in a new line, itcan lead to attempting to read memory prior to the start of the givenbuffer which may result in a crash. This issue is fixed in c-ares 1.27.0.No known workarounds exist.

criterions.comment: c-ares: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
